s: ^a box?
^cool
^im sorry to hear that

c-2: ^I'll have you know I graduated on top of my class in the Cuboid as the Top Cube. I've got 6 confirmed sides and 8 different points, way more than any other 3D shapes in the whole state. On top of that, the 12 lines surrounding my body is of high level and fidelity that it beats any other Cubers out there. You have NO idea who you are talking to you polygonal humanoid schmuck. You're in dead waters, kiddo.

s: ^I don't deserve this
^I can't believe this

c-0: ^You keep making the same mistake every time
c-1: ^You have to, this is what happened

s: ^Nothing
^I didn't expect things to turn out this way

c-1: ^Expectations always hurt, but such is reality

nothing: ^Are you sure? You don't seem okay

s: ^I am alright, it's just the weather
^Things happened, but it's alright, maybe, I guess...

three: ^You need to be strong, you can't let emotions control you

s: ^It's hard, it's very very hard
^I know, I am trying to

c-1: ^I don't see it, you are under a illusion, and that is hurting you

hard: ^Life is hard, you have to prepare yourself

s: ^I am trying my best! You don't understand how painful it is!
^Fuck this preparing, it's cruel, it is unfair, it is WRONG!

c-0: ^I understand, but you are hurting yourself
c-1: ^It's wrong only to you, you are allowing yourself to feel this pain

four: ^How are you doing now? Are things better?

s: ^I keep having panic attacks all night
^I don't feel happiness anymore

panic: ^You do realise things were never what you thought them to be, right?

s: ^I do, but it doesn't help me
^Yes, but then why were things like that? Were all those words and tears fake?

c-0: ^Then realise that this is not what you deserve, and move on
c-1: ^Maybe it was, maybe not, but the answer won't help you

unhappiness: ^Try to meet new people, participate in activities, and focus on yourself

s: ^I have lost motivation
^I think these are distractions, nothing else

c-0: ^You had a life before this happened, and a life after, right? Do what has always made you feel happy
c-1: ^Think of them as medicines that help you recover faster, that make you feel better about yourself

five: ^It's been some time, has the grief subsided?

s: ^Grief is a cycle, it comes and goes
^A bit, the sadness is there, but the suffering not so much
^The triggers disturb me, otherwise I am okay
^I am slowly feeling the urge to create again

c-0: ^Yes, try to forgive and forget, and carry the lessons forward
c-1: ^That's good! You are on the path to acceptance, I am proud of you.

life: ^That's how it goes, doesn't it? That's life

s: ^The loops in my head have found their answers, and it points to the same thing
^Let people choose what they think they deserve, I know I have to make a wiser choice

c-0: ^Yes, you didn't deserve this, and you are better off now
c-1: ^Yes, you are capable of it, just think and choose carefully before giving in

aurora_lasagna_test: ^The cliff is a vertical sheet of frozen midnight.
^Above, the aurora stretches like a debugging overlay across the polar sky.

b: ^AURORA: "Ah. The one whose soul smells faintly of lasagna..."
^AURORA: "And you came packing with a lasagna already, interesting"

aurora_lasagna_test: ^YOU: "…How many things am I even carrying right now?"
^You glance at an invisible UI panel only you can see.

b: ^The comforting weight of lasagna presses against your pack.
^Your pack contains zero lasagnas. This feels like a design oversight.

aurora_lasagna_test: ^"Uh… can you spawn a lasagna for me?"
^"Let me check how much lasagna I'm hoarding."

conjure_lasagna: ^AURORA: "Naturally. What *kind* of lasagna manifestation do you desire?"
^A purely symbolic lasagna that somehow still counts as an item.

c-0: ^The aurora folds into a perfectly rectangular slab of lasagna and drops it into your pack.
c-1: ^A faint icon of lasagna quietly appears in your inventory.
^YOU: "I'm scared to ask how many there are."

inspect_lasagna: ^YOU: "Hang on, let me check my lasagna situation."
^That's either one meal or twenty-four bad decisions."
^AURORA: "The first step is admitting you are lasagna-positive."
lasagna_menu: ^AURORA: "So what will you do with this cheesy attachment?"
^Throw the lasagna dramatically off the cliff.
^Keep climbing while clinging to your lasagna.
eat_lasagna: ^YOU: "If this breaks causality, at least I'll die full."
^You devour the lasagna with reckless, texture-agnostic enthusiasm.
drop_lasagna: ^You hold the lasagna over the abyss like a cheesy offering to gravity.
^YOU: "This is for character growth… and maybe performance."
^The lasagna spins away, trailing shredded metaphor into the dark.
^AURORA: "Sometimes letting go is just freeing a slot in your inventory."
climb_with_lasagna: ^You readjust your pack so the lasagna sits comfortably against your back.

b: ^The dish radiates a faint, suspicious warmth.
^The lasagna seems to exist only as a flag in the sky labeled "got_lasagna".

climb_with_lasagna: ^AURORA: "Climbing while refusing to let go. Classic."
climb_plain: ^You dig your fingers into the frozen rock and start climbing in stubborn silence.

b: ^Despite your denial, lasagna sloshes gently in your pack with every move.
^Your stomach growls, providing an ambient horror soundtrack.

climb_plain: ^AURORA: "Fine. We'll pretend this isn't secretly a lasagna tutorial."
final_ledge: ^After a long, chilly ascent, you reach a narrow ledge halfway up the cliff.
^The aurora hangs above you like a progress bar that forgot what it was loading.

b: ^The lasagna is still with you, heavier than any piece of gear.
^Only the memory of lasagna weighs on you now.
^AURORA: "You met lasagna, made choices, and the story remembered."
^AURORA: "You climbed without ever truly embracing lasagna. That's also a valid build."

final_ledge: ^YOU: "So what's the verdict? Am I ready to let go yet?"
^AURORA: "Maybe. But first, a tiny safety net for the next run."

b: ^YOU: "…Did you just slip a lasagna into my pocket?"

final_ledge: ^The aurora reaches down and taps an invisible *Save & Quit* button in the sky.
